definitions.text: a solution obtained by steeping or soaking a substance (usually in water)
a passage selected from a larger work
examples: he presented excerpts from William James' philosophical writings

definitions.text: remove, usually with some force or effort; also used in an abstract sense

examples: I extracted a promise from the Dean for two new positions
We drew out some interesting linguistic data from the native informant

definitions.text: extract by the process of distillation
examples: distill the essence of this compound

definitions.text: obtain from a substance, as by mechanical action
examples: Italians express coffee rather than filter it

definitions.text: take out of a literary work in order to cite or copy
calculate the root of a number
